title: hudson bay again... please help with typeface id
content:
could someone help me id these typefaces

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110514170304im_/http:/typophile.com/files/2476583847_135ced5f99_4507.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110514170304im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Coat_of_Arms-5-scroll_5047.jpg)
author: Bart Piwowarczyk

comments.content:
I think the Hudson's Bay Company logo and the lettering in the banner are custom lettering. The main logo is a simplified blackletter script, somewhat like [Cloister Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20110514170304/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/cloister-black/) or [Agincourt](http://web.archive.org/web/20110514170304/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/agincourt/), but it doesn't match any blackletter font I could find.

I think the sans serif lettering at the bottom of the sign looks like Helvetica.

- Mike Yanega

thanks.. here are two more images of the blackletter-like typeface

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110514170304im_/http:/typophile.com/files/800px-Hudsons_Bay-Logo-Old_3991.JPG)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110514170304im_/http:/typophile.com/files/hbc_logo_4017.jpg)

You'll notice that the lettering of the company name is not the same in each instance. Further argument for custom lettering.

- Mike Yanega
